summary: This document is a chain of emails from March 2024 between attorneys and a paralegal, primarily discussing the sharing of evidence related to the Epstein case. The evidence includes a 2012 journal with entries from more than 20 people, and photos allegedly showing Jeffrey Epstein with a young woman on a boat in Oak Bluffs, Martha's Vineyard, reportedly taken by Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Meredith Firetog
persons.context: Paralegal involved in coordinating the sharing of documents, including a 2012 journal and photos, between legal teams.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: Attorney representing a client in the Epstein case, possessing and sharing evidence including a 2012 journal and photos of Epstein.

persons.name: Douglas Wigdor
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email chain regarding the sharing of evidence related to Epstein and Leon Black.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a shared folder for the case "US v. Black" and in the subject line regarding photos with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the photos being discussed; shown on a boat with a young woman in Oak Bluffs, Martha's Vineyard.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Allegedly took the photos of Jeffrey Epstein with a young woman on a boat in Martha's Vineyard.

connections.description: Legal professional correspondence regarding the transfer of evidence (journal, photos) related to the Epstein case.
Colleagues at Wigdor law firm, both copied on emails concerning evidence sharing.
Maxwell is alleged to have taken photos of Epstein with a young woman on a boat.
Implied connection through the subject line "L. Black, photos with JE" and the reference to a shared case folder.
Christensen references "our client" who provided information about the photos and the journal.

events.title: Creation of Journal
events.description: A journal from 2012 is referenced, containing entries from more than 20 contemporaneous writers. The journal and a typed translation were shared as evidence.

events.title: Epstein on Boat in Martha's Vineyard
events.description: Photos allegedly show Jeffrey Epstein on the side of a boat with a young blond woman in Oak Bluffs harbor, Martha's Vineyard. The photos were reportedly taken by Ghislaine Maxwell during a one-night stay.

events.title: Evidence Sharing Between Legal Teams
events.description: A series of emails coordinating the secure transfer of evidence, including the 2012 journal and photos, via a shared folder link.

locations: 85 Fifth Avenue, New York, NY (Wigdor LLP office)
keyFacts: A 2012 journal exists with entries from more than 20 people; their contact information is reportedly available.
Photos allegedly show Jeffrey Epstein with a young blond woman on a boat in Oak Bluffs, Martha's Vineyard, in the summer of 2005.
Ghislaine Maxwell is alleged to have taken these photos.
The evidence (journal and photos) was being shared between legal professionals in March 2024 in relation to the Epstein case and the case "US v. Black".
The email chain demonstrates ongoing legal activity and evidence review related to Jeffrey Epstein and his associates in 2024.
